PAULINA, - daughter of - Mr Warren & Mrs Freelove - Batcheller, - died Oct 1, 1820, - in the 6th year - of her age. - Sleep on sweet child, & take thy rest - God called thee home, he thought it best

In Memory of
Mr Charles Easterbrooks
who died
March 8,
1799
aged 89 years
& 3 Days

In Memory of
Mr John Stuart
Dec'd December
Ye 17... and y
50th Year of his
Age

Here Lie interred the earthly
remains of
MRS MARY MARTIN,
the amiable companion of
WHEELER MARTIN,
& daughter of
Charles & Amey Eastabrooke
late of Providence.
She was born on the 13th day
of Aug. A.D. 1766.
and died March 10, 1831,
being 64 years, 6 months
and 10 days old.

She was an affectionate Wife,
a good Neighbour,
and a believer in that Salvation
which the Son of God
extended to the whole family of
the earth in his death & suffering
on Calvary's Cross.

"Eternity! transporting sound
While God & Jesus reign in heaven,
Fulness of joy shall there be found,
Shall make immortal praises."

Iconography Description: Weeping willow tree and funeral urn
Claude Transcription:
Sacred to the Memory of
-the Hon.
-WHEELER MARTIN,
-8th son of
-Silvanus Martin, Esq. of Rehoboth, Mass.
-Born Aug. 16, 1765.
-& died at Seekonk, May 22, 1836.
-in his 71st year.
-
-For many years he held the office
-of Chief Justice of the Court of Common Pleas
-for the county of Providence:
-& one of the Associate Justices
-of the Supreme Judicial Court of
-the state of Rhode-Island.
-
-Adieu, thou soul, ye stars & moon,
-No longer shall I need your light;
-My sun, he makes my night,
-My day shall never change to night.
THOMAS H. GREEN - 1817 — 1898 - HIS WIFE - SCARBOROUGH TRADER - 819 — 1888

In Memory of
MRS MOLLY KNOWLES
Wife of
Mr. EDWARD KNOWLES,
and Daughter of
Maj. THOMAS BOWEN of Rehoboth.
She died Dec. 31, 1821,
in the 78th year
of her age.

A virtuous woman, prudent and sincere,
A tender wife and parent, slumbers here.
With Martha's care, she still had Mary's part,
The world employ'd her hands, but Heaven her heart.

In Memory of
- Mrs FREELOVE BATCHELLER,
- wife of
- Mr WARREN BATCHELLER.
- She died Sept. 11,
- 1820,
- in the 30th year
- of her age.
- Friends and Physicians could not save
- Her mortal body from the grave;
- Nor can the grave confine her here,
- When Christ shall call her to appear.

Iconography Description: Decorative urn with draped swags and floral motifs
Claude Transcription:
This Stone is dedicated
to the Memory of
Mr GARDNER BENSON
who departed this Life
January 24th 1796
Aged 49.
His moral Character was blameless
but his Hope was in CHRIST.

His mind was tranquil and serene
No terrors in his looks were seen
A SAVIOR's smile dispel'd the gloom
And smooth'd his Passage to the Tomb.

Iconography Description: Weeping willow tree in central medallion, flanked by two smaller circular motifs with floral or rosette designs
Claude Transcription:
IN
- Memory of
- Mrs.
- ABIGAIL BUCKLIN,
- wife of
- Mr. NATHAN BUCKLIN,
- who died Aug. 20, 1840,
- in the 39th year
- of her age.
- Sleep precious dust in calm repose,
- This life and pangs are at a close,
- Thy happy soul with Jesus rest,
- In heavenly mansions with the blest.

In Memory of
ANNA

-
MY PRESENCE SHALL GO WITH THEE
AND I WILL GIVE THEE REST

Claude Transcription:
In this Silent Mansion
are deposited the Remains of
JEREMIAH KNOWLES
Youngest Son of
Edward and Molly Knowles
who clos'd this Earthly scene
on the 22 of Jan'y 1810
in the 36th Year of his Age
Such was the Virtuous Life
of this Beloved Youth
that his final hour sweet
peace and heavenly hope
reviv'd beyond on his
Ex[?]ted Soul
